qas.question: Nutritional standards and recommendations are produced by a joint effort between the US Department of Agriculture and which other department?

answers.text: US Department of Health and Human Services

qas.question: Who releases guidelines that revolve around diet and physical activity recommendations?
What is the name of the concept that has replaced the food pyramid?
The USDA's effort sand actions are overseen by which governmental committee?
On which channel are committee meetings often shown?

context: In the US, nutritional standards and recommendations are established jointly by the US Department of Agriculture and <a0_0>US Department of Health and Human Services<a0_0/>. Dietary and physical activity guidelines from the <a1_0>USDA<a1_0/> are presented in the concept of <a2_0>MyPlate<a2_0/>, which superseded the food pyramid, which replaced the Four Food Groups. The Senate committee currently responsible for oversight of the USDA is the <a3_0>Agriculture, Nutrition and Forestry Committee<a3_0/>. Committee hearings are often televised on <a4_0>C-SPAN<a4_0/>.
